item.description: Brief Vitae 04/2018- &nbsp &nbsp now PhD in nanophysics Universidad Aut贸noma de Madrid Title: Effects of the electrostatic environment on semiconductor/superconductor heterostructures; Advisors: Elsa Prada and Alfredo Levy Yeyati. 12/2017- 03/2018 Research assistant Universidad Aut贸noma de Madrid Project: Visualizing, understanding and controlling Andreev Bound States down to atomic scale, funded by IFIMAC. 09/2016- 06/2017 Master's degree in Condensed matter physics Universidad Aut贸noma de Madrid Nanophysics specialization.

Note: Some of the posters and talks were presented in conferences before their corresponding work was published. Hence, their files may contain incorrect or incomplete information. 06/2021 CMD 29: Bound states in hybrid superconductor nanostructures International mini-colloquium organized (online) by the European Physics Society at Manchester. Oral contribution entitled "Fluxoid antipairing effect and zero energy pinning in non-topological QD/full-shell hybrid nanowires". 06/2021 TopoSuper2021 Emergent Topological Superconductivity International conference organized (online) by the NANOCOHYBRI COST Action 16218 at Aalto.

Scientific publications 07/2021 Vortex-induced pairing suppression and near-zero modes in quantum dots coupled to full-shell nanowires arXiv:2107.13011 (2021) Authors: Samuel D. Escribano, Alfredo Levy Yeyati, Ram贸n Aguado, Elsa Prada and Pablo San-Jose.
